summary: This is an FBI Director's morning news briefing summarizing media coverage from February 22-24, 2019. It focuses on the impending conclusion of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's Russia investigation, political reactions to the expected report, and related legal developments involving figures like Paul Manafort and Michael Cohen. It also covers other FBI-related news stories from that period.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Repeatedly asserts there was no collusion or obstruction in the Russia investigation and criticizes the Mueller probe. Also comments on other cases like the Coast Guard lieutenant arrest.

persons.name: Robert Mueller
persons.context: Leading the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election. His impending final report is the central topic of the briefing.

persons.name: Adam Schiff
persons.context: Threatens to subpoena Mueller and sue the Trump administration if the full Mueller report is not made public.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Subject of Democratic pressure to release the full Mueller report without sanitizing it.

persons.name: Kamala Harris
persons.context: Advocates for transparency and a public Mueller report on CNN's Inside Politics.

persons.name: Ed Markey
persons.context: Warns against the Attorney General sanitizing the Mueller report on CBS' Face The Nation.

persons.name: Roy Blunt
persons.context: Expresses uncertainty about subpoenaing Mueller and says the Senate investigation is ongoing.

persons.name: Lindsey Graham
persons.context: States his belief that there was no collusion and that the Mueller report should end the matter if it finds none.

persons.name: Paul Manafort
persons.context: Subject of a damning sentencing memo from Mueller's team alleging he 'repeatedly and brazenly' broke the law. Also facing potential state charges from Manhattan DA.

persons.name: Konstantin Kilimnik
persons.context: Described as having suspected ties to Russian intelligence and interacting with Manafort during the campaign. Given polling data from the Trump campaign.

persons.name: Michael Cohen
persons.context: Reportedly met with prosecutors to discuss the Trump Organization and is scheduled to testify before Congress.

persons.name: Andrew McCabe
persons.context: Promotes his book, claims he is 'speaking truth to power,' and discusses the FBI's Russia investigation. Plans to sue the DOJ over his firing.

persons.name: Peter Strzok
persons.context: Told Congress that a text about an 'insurance policy' referred to potentially burning a source, not the Trump investigation.

persons.name: Lisa Page
persons.context: Told Congress that a text about an 'insurance policy' referred to potentially burning a source, not the Trump investigation.

persons.name: Steve Bannon
persons.context: Accuses Democrats of trying to weaponize Mueller's findings and predicts a vitriolic year in politics.

persons.name: Cyrus Vance Jr.
persons.context: Reportedly preparing state criminal charges against Paul Manafort related to bank loans.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: His handling of a plea deal with financier Jeffrey Epstein is under review by the White House.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Wealthy financier accused of sexually abusing underage girls; his non-prosecution agreement handled by Acosta is being scrutinized.

persons.name: Jussie Smollett
persons.context: Actor charged with staging a hate crime attack; FBI investigating and he was cut from his show 'Empire'.

persons.name: Donald Trump Jr.
persons.context: Compares Jussie Smollett to Christine Blasey Ford and Nathan Phillips in a tweet about 'politically motivated hate crime hoax'.

connections.description: Mueller is investigating Russian interference in the 2016 election and potential links to the Trump campaign, which Trump repeatedly denies.
Kilimnik is a longtime associate and suspected Russian intelligence link who interacted with Manafort during the Trump campaign.
Manafort served as Trump's campaign chairman in 2016.
Cohen was Trump's longtime personal attorney and 'fixer' who is now cooperating with prosecutors.
Both were FBI officials involved in the Russia investigation; their text messages about an 'insurance policy' were discussed in Congress.
McCabe, fired from the FBI, is a vocal critic of Trump and claims the administration discussed using the 25th Amendment.
As U.S. Attorney in Miami, Acosta oversaw a non-prosecution agreement for Epstein, which is now under review.

events.title: Trump Tweets About Mueller Probe
events.description: President Trump tweets, asserting the only collusion was with Hillary Clinton and the DNC, and demands texts between FBI agents Lisa Page and Peter Strzok.

events.title: Democrats Demand Public Mueller Report
events.description: Democratic lawmakers, including Adam Schiff and Kamala Harris, appear on Sunday talk shows to demand the full Mueller report be made public.

events.title: Mueller's Sentencing Memo for Manafort
events.description: Mueller's office files an 800-page sentencing memo stating Paul Manafort 'repeatedly and brazenly' broke the law over a decade.

events.title: Manhattan DA Plans State Charges Against Manafort
events.description: Reports indicate the Manhattan District Attorney's office is preparing state criminal charges against Paul Manafort, possibly to preempt a presidential pardon.

events.title: White House Reviews Acosta's Epstein Deal
events.description: The White House states it is 'looking into' Labor Secretary Alex Acosta's handling of a plea deal with Jeffrey Epstein while Acosta was U.S. Attorney.

events.title: Jussie Smollett Charged
events.description: Actor Jussie Smollett is charged with a felony for allegedly staging a hate crime attack. The FBI is investigating and he is cut from 'Empire'.

events.title: Cohen to Testify Before Congress
events.description: Michael Cohen, former Trump attorney, is scheduled to testify before Congress about his knowledge of Trump's business dealings.

keyFacts: The imminent conclusion of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's Russia investigation dominates the news, with intense political debate over whether the full report will be made public.

Mueller's prosecutors filed a damning sentencing memo for Paul Manafort, alleging he 'repeatedly and brazenly' broke the law, but it did not reveal new information about campaign conspiracy with Russia.
The Manhattan District Attorney's office is preparing state charges against Paul Manafort, seen as a move to ensure prison time even if he receives a federal pardon.
Labor Secretary Alex Acosta's role in a non-prosecution agreement for Jeffrey Epstein is under review by the White House.
Actor Jussie Smollett was charged with staging a hate crime, prompting an FBI investigation and his removal from the TV show 'Empire'.
